alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 6:08PM MDT until May 24 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL PUEBLO COUNTY... At 608 PM MDT, Local law enforcement reported street flooding and water rescues in the warned area at 5:30 PM MDT. Water levels were up to car windows in the area of the 1700 block of North Platteville in Pueblo West. Thunderstorms are producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northern Pueblo and Pueblo West. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
